entity.name: Popover API
entity.description: Pain points specific to Popover API.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points specific to Popover API.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points specific to Popover API.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: <​dialog> Element
entity.description: Pain points related to the native HTML `<dialog>` element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the native HTML <dialog> element.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the native HTML <dialog> element.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: Reliance on JavaScript
entity.description: Lack of declarative APIs, slow rendering due to dependence on correct loading & execution of JS, issues around the higher barrier-to-entry of JS APIs, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Lack of declarative APIs, slow rendering due to dependence on correct loading & execution of JS, issues around the higher barrier-to-entry of JS APIs, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of declarative APIs, slow rendering due to dependence on correct loading & execution of JS, issues around the higher barrier-to-entry of JS APIs, etc.

entity.name: DOM APIs
entity.description: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.

entity.name: HTML Reuse
entity.description: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.

entity.name: Templating & rendering
entity.description: Authoring and running templates, data binding, reactive rendering, Declarative Shadow DOM, and server boundaries. Also includes issues related to the <template> element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Authoring and running templates, data binding, reactive rendering, Declarative Shadow DOM, and server boundaries. Also includes issues related to the  element.
entity.descriptionClean: Authoring and running templates, data binding, reactive rendering, Declarative Shadow DOM, and server boundaries. Also includes issues related to the  element.

entity.name: Reactive rendering & data bindings
entity.description: Issues with reactivity
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues with reactivity
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with reactivity

entity.name: Declarative APIs
entity.description: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with `limitations`), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with `ergonomics`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).
entity.descriptionClean: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).

entity.name: <​details>/<​summary>
entity.description: Pain points related to the <details> and <summary> elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the  and  elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the  and  elements, including styling limitations (especially the marker), animation difficulties, and accessibility concerns.

entity.name: Accessibility
entity.description: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Obstacles in providing accessible experiences (regardless of cause), assistive‑tech compatibility, etc.

entity.name: ARIA
entity.description: Issues related to using Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA) attributes and patterns.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to using Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA) attributes and patterns.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to using Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA) attributes and patterns.

entity.name: Event management
entity.description: Issues around events, complex interactions being hard to define via events, etc. For issues around handling events, including event composition, retargeting, and authoring patterns across light/shadow boundaries, combine with `cross_root`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around events, complex interactions being hard to define via events, etc. For issues around handling events, including event composition, retargeting, and authoring patterns across light/shadow boundaries, combine with cross_root.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around events, complex interactions being hard to define via events, etc. For issues around handling events, including event composition, retargeting, and authoring patterns across light/shadow boundaries, combine with cross_root.

entity.name: CSS Anchor Positioning
entity.description: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

entity.name: Styling and UI customization
entity.description: Issues around styling and customizing browser-generated UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around styling and customizing browser-generated UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around styling and customizing browser-generated UI.

entity.name: Styling
entity.description: Issues around styling UA-generated UI, CSS not working in certain contexts, etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around styling UA-generated UI, CSS not working in certain contexts, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around styling UA-generated UI, CSS not working in certain contexts, etc.

entity.name: Focus Management
entity.description: Challenges with managing focus, especially in dynamic contexts. Includes focus trapping, roving tabindex, moving focus programmatically, and preserving focus when DOM elements are added, removed, or moved.
entity.descriptionHtml: Challenges with managing focus, especially in dynamic contexts. Includes focus trapping, roving tabindex, moving focus programmatically, and preserving focus when DOM elements are added, removed, or moved.
entity.descriptionClean: Challenges with managing focus, especially in dynamic contexts. Includes focus trapping, roving tabindex, moving focus programmatically, and preserving focus when DOM elements are added, removed, or moved.

entity.name: Performance
entity.description: Throughput, latency, memory, jank, lag, frame drops, battery/thermal, and loading time.
entity.descriptionHtml: Throughput, latency, memory, jank, lag, frame drops, battery/thermal, and loading time.
entity.descriptionClean: Throughput, latency, memory, jank, lag, frame drops, battery/thermal, and loading time.

entity.name: htmx Features
entity.description: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.
entity.descriptionHtml: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.

entity.name: Partial Page Updates
entity.description: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.
entity.descriptionHtml: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.
entity.descriptionClean: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.

entity.name: Top Layer
entity.description: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like <dialog> and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Accordion functionality
entity.description: Group `<details>` elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionHtml: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionClean: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.

example.code:
<details open name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Main info</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
<details name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Style</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
example.codeHighlighted: <details open name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Main info</summary> <!-- controls --> </details> <details name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Style</summary> <!-- controls --> </details>

resources.title: Add name attribute for grouping details elements into an exclusive accordion by dbaron · Pull Request #9400 · whatwg/html · GitHub
Exclusive accordion (<details name="">) · Issue #866 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
webFeature.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements

entity.name: Tabs element
entity.description: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.

entity.name: Invokers / Commands
entity.description: Pain points and feedback related to the proposed Invokers and Command attributes for declaratively triggering actions on other elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points and feedback related to the proposed Invokers and Command attributes for declaratively triggering actions on other elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points and feedback related to the proposed Invokers and Command attributes for declaratively triggering actions on other elements.

example.code:
<button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal">
  Show modal dialog
</button>
<dialog id="mydialog">
  <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close">
    Close
  </button>
  *dialog content*
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal"> Show modal dialog </button> <dialog id="mydialog"> <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close"> Close </button> *dialog content* </dialog>

resources.title: Invoker Commands: Additional Ways to Work With Dialog, Popover… and More?

webFeature.description_html: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
webFeature.name: Invoker commands
